hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with chocolate mint brownies that's

you really want to use a high-quality

not starting to brown yet you probably
don't want to go that far but you
definitely want it hot I'm gonna dump
that into the bowl of sugar and cocoa
and I'm gonna stir that in and it's
gonna form sort of a wet chocolaty mud
now I've basically eliminated any proper
techniques from this video this thing
looks horrible until it's cooked so that

totally works once that's mixed in I'm
gonna add some vanilla and some salts
and an egg we're gonna add two eggs but

can't stress how horrible this recipe
looks all along the way so real bakers
all over the country are basically

they'll be fine alright I'm gonna go

which is what you're looking for see

you know what also works like a spatula
a spatula so I switch to that I finished

okay
it's an ugly ugly batter that produces a
very very dense fudgy

it does all right we're gonna transfer

really get that top smooth which will

I'm gonna give it the old tap a tap

have a little chocolate on it but it's
not gonna look like all raw batter on
there and then please please please let
that cool completely before we put on
the mint icing which is what we're gonna

it's powdered sugar a little bit of mint

milk and that's really all there is to
it now when it comes to the extract you
want to be careful you can even do that
to taste put in a couple drops taste it
and adjust because some extracts are
stronger than others and you do not want
your mint I seem to taste like
toothpaste and that's what will happen
if you put too much men in once it is
completely smooth and mixed it looks
like that you're gonna dump it over your
cool brownies spread it out it should
just be a thin thin layer you do not
want like a half-inch thick layer of
this you can see the brownie underneath
that really is all you want on there but
that's up to you you're the boss of your
icing all right so once you've dumped it
on and spread it over you're just gonna
let that sit out for about 30 minutes
until it completely sets it'll basically
dry out and it'll look like that and
when that happens you can go ahead and
slice and portion your brownies you
should probably get 12 or 16 small

put it in a little plastic bag you've
